title: 2PC Protocol
description: This project demonstrates the importance of building fault-tolerant systems, as even a single node failure can cause the entire system to fail. It evaluates different types of failures, such as node failures and TC failures, showing the crucial role of the transaction coordinator in coordinating transactions between nodes and ensuring that they commit or abort in a consistent and reliable manner.

title: Variational Autoencoder on Breast Cancer Histopathology
description: Developed a deep understanding of autoencoder architectures, focusing on data compression, reconstruction, and capturing the underlying structure of input data. Implemented a VAE model, incorporating an encoder, decoder, and a specialized loss function that balanced reconstruction error with a regularization term.

title: Camera Aid for Blind
description: Developed a mobile-based camera vision system that can be used to create an independent application for visually challenged people. The system detects and measures distances of objects within a few meters, navigates on sidewalks on roads, recognizes texts on signboards, objects, etc., overcoming issues of cost, reliance, and usability.

title: Driver Drowsiness Detection
description: Built a drowsy driver alert system using OpenCV to detect faces and eyes using a Haar-cascade classifier. Extracted features from eyes and the face region to predict the driver's status, enhancing road safety.
